is.hello.buruberi.bluetooth.stacks

Interface BluetoothStack


  • public interface BluetoothStack
    Provides methods for discovering Bluetooth Low Energy peripherals, inspecting user device support level, and controlling power state of the device's Bluetooth radio.
    See Also:
    GattPeripheral

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  BluetoothStack.SupportLevel
      Describes the level of support the current device has in the implementation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String LOG_TAG
      The log tag that of BluetoothStack use.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      rx.Observable<java.util.List<GattPeripheral>> discoverPeripherals(PeripheralCriteria peripheralCriteria)
      Performs a scan for peripherals matching a given set of criteria.
      rx.Observable<java.lang.Boolean> enabled()
      Returns an observable that will continuously report the power state of the device's bluetooth radio.
      boolean errorRequiresReconnect(java.lang.Throwable e)
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not a given error is fatal for the BluetoothStack implementation, and the client code should disconnect and perform a rediscovery.
      BluetoothStack.SupportLevel getDeviceSupportLevel()
      Returns the level of support the stack has for the current device.
      LoggerFacade getLogger()
      Returns the logger facade associated with the BluetoothStack.
      rx.Scheduler getScheduler()
      Returns the RxJava Scheduler used for all stack operations.
      boolean isEnabled()
      Returns the current power state of the device's bluetooth radio.
      <T> rx.Observable<T> newConfiguredObservable(rx.Observable.OnSubscribe<T> onSubscribe)
      Vends an observable configured appropriately for use with this BluetoothStack.
      rx.Observable<java.lang.Void> turnOff()
      Turns off the device's Bluetooth radio.
      rx.Observable<java.lang.Void> turnOn()
      Turns on the device's Bluetooth radio.

    • Field Detail

      • LOG_TAG

        static final java.lang.String LOG_TAG
        The log tag that of BluetoothStack use.

    • Method Detail

      • discoverPeripherals

        rx.Observable<java.util.List<GattPeripheral>> discoverPeripherals(PeripheralCriteria peripheralCriteria)
        Performs a scan for peripherals matching a given set of criteria.

        Yields UserDisabledBuruberiException if the device's Bluetooth radio is currently disabled.

        See Also:
        PeripheralCriteria

      • getScheduler

        rx.Scheduler getScheduler()
        Returns the RxJava Scheduler used for all stack operations.

      • newConfiguredObservable

        <T> rx.Observable<T> newConfiguredObservable(rx.Observable.OnSubscribe<T> onSubscribe)
        Vends an observable configured appropriately for use with this BluetoothStack.
        Returns:
        A configured Observable.
        See Also:
        getScheduler()

      • enabled

        rx.Observable<java.lang.Boolean> enabled()
        Returns an observable that will continuously report the power state of the device's bluetooth radio.
        See Also:
        for one time values.

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Returns the current power state of the device's bluetooth radio.
        See Also:
        for observations over time.

      • turnOn

        rx.Observable<java.lang.Void> turnOn()
        Turns on the device's Bluetooth radio.
        See Also:
        ChangePowerStateException

      • turnOff

        rx.Observable<java.lang.Void> turnOff()
        Turns off the device's Bluetooth radio.
        See Also:
        ChangePowerStateException

      • errorRequiresReconnect

        boolean errorRequiresReconnect(java.lang.Throwable e)
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not a given error is fatal for the BluetoothStack implementation, and the client code should disconnect and perform a rediscovery.

      • getLogger

        LoggerFacade getLogger()
        Returns the logger facade associated with the BluetoothStack.

      • getDeviceSupportLevel

        BluetoothStack.SupportLevel getDeviceSupportLevel()
        Returns the level of support the stack has for the current device.
